alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Franklin and southeastern St. Lawrence Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Oswegatchie to near Alger Island Public Campground. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oswegatchie, Piercefield, Carry Falls Reservoir, Horseshoe Lake, Degrasse, Cranberry Lake, Star Lake, Fine, Pitcairn, Stark, Lower Oswegatchie, Aldrich, Conifer, Wanakena, Higley Flow State Park, South Edwards, Gale, Newton Falls, Childwold and Shurtleff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence
